result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall James Arndt #426786 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randall James Arndt #426786 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Randall James Arndt #426786 was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Randall James Arndt #426786 was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham February 10, 2015 - Amend Count 1 to 1 year probation.

Court dismisses Counts 2, 4, 5 & 6.



In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF529.
$200.00 DNA Surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF529.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-No Contact with Tammy Osborne, but the Court let this be changed at the discretion of the District Attorney's Office.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Order for payment on July 15, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

From DE in writing on 2-20-19.  DE still in custody in Polk County Jail as of today.  DE to pay $40/mo comm 7-15-19 (Feb - June pymts missed/deferred).  DE will be mailed an updated Order for Pymt. Includes 14CF529, 16TR4828, 17CF105. jaf

from DE re: payment plan. gme 
 Quash warrants (if any for non-payment) and set for OFP in late April.  Send his notice c/o Polk Cty jail.  Judge N
DE did not appear for or call to R/S his Pymt Plan appt on 1-07-19.  Pymt Plan to remain as scheduled.  Includes 14CF529, 16TR4828, 17CF105.  jaf

DE called re:  Pymt Plan stating his parents notified him that he needs to contact the C of C by 1-15-19.  DE was advised that his pymt is due 1-15-19 & that I had mailed him an updated Pymt Plan Agmt to the address on file as he had not provided one on his request.  DE stated the address that it was mailed to was his parent's address & he does not live there.  DE was advised that his pymt of $40 is due 1-15-19 per Judge's order & that the judge did note he is not to receive any add'l exts.  DE stated he cannot afford to pay $40/mo as he has several other bills, pymts due to DOC & other counties, his gf's car broke down, is short after the holidays, & doesn't understand why we just don't intercept his taxes like other counties.  DE was advised that we have entered his balances thru Tax Intercept, but that if other places have done so before us, those debts will be pd first.  DE went on to say that he doesn't understand why he has to pay several DNA surcharges & was advised that this is a state statute.  DE also inquired if the Judge would write off some of the court costs as he cannot afford to pay these balances although he's working.  DE was advised he may meet w/me on 1-07-19 to amend his Pymt Plan down to $20/mo, but that he is not allowed to skip Jan's pymt & that he could write a letter to the Judge addressing the other balances.  DE stated he didn't understand why he has to pay us and DOC if DOC is dispersing the money to us anyway, which the DE was advised that the balances that he is on a Pymt Plan for are not balances that are being collected by DOC & if he needs further clarification on this, to call his Probation Agent.  DE was reminded to call me to R/S if he cannot make his appt on 1-07-19.  Includes 14CF529, 16TR4828, 17CF105.  jaf
State Debt Collection - Notice of Intent returned from post office, refused/undeliverable as addressed/unable to forward/attempted not known. gme

Order for payment on January 28, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
DE mailed copy to the updated address on this date.  jaf

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung  DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman DF: Randall James Arndt appeared. Case called at 4:20. Sentencing arguements. ADA Hartung updates the court. 
On Count 1 - 30 days St. Croix County Jail concurrent to Polk County case. 
- Court authorizes huber for work. 
On Count 3- 160 days St. Croix County Jail concurrent to Polk County case. 
Credit for 104 days. Credit for good time. 

Court authorizes DE to serve in Polk County, if arrangements can be made by Fri. June 19, 2015. Sate has until Fri. at noon to configure credit. 
Bonds continue.
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2015 at 04:15 pm.

-Testing at reasonable suspicion or at the Courts directive. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Grace Place and Tammy O.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Randall James Arndt appeared. Case called at 838. Court reviews file. Hearing today is the DE wish to refuse probation. Atty. Chapman updates the court, DE wishes to refuse probation. Court informs the DE of the charges. Court questions DE about his decision to refuse probation. DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly refuses probation. Court will accept the DE wishes to refuse probation. ADA Nieskes updates the court and does not request a PSI. ADA Nieskes request sentencing out a week. Address confirmed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
Filed by Atty Chapman. Def wishes to refuse probation. km
Hearing on June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Daniel James Chapman, DF: Randall James Arndt appeared from jail.  Court called at 4:35 p.m. Set for PTC.  DE has filed a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form.  ADA Nieskes recites the agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to amended Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct without the domestic abuse enhancer and Ct. 3. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Attorney's stipulate to the facts.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1  Disorderly Conduct without the domestic abuse enhancer and Ct. 3. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, Ct 4, Ct 5 & Ct 6. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- Court orders 40 days in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for time served
- AODA with follow through   
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Random and regular testing
- No contact with any person that uses, manufactures, deals or distributes drugs except in a treatment setting.     
- No contact with Tammy Osborne but the court will let this be changed at the discretion of the DA's office.  
- Court costs and DNA surcharge costs
- 20 days to appeal
Filed by Assistant District Attorney Michael Nieskes.
Atty Chapman. hml
Atty Chapman. hml
filed by ADA Michael Nieskes. eif
Pre-trial conference on January 23, 2015 at 04:30 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tammy O. and Grace Place.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

 -Report every Wed. and Sat by 5:00 before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
